summary: This is an email chain from July 2021 between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and an American Express manager regarding follow-up questions about a document production related to the Epstein case. The chain references a prior subpoena from June 2020 and involves coordination with other legal and financial personnel.

persons.name: Kristina Lee Hendrickson
persons.role: Manager - Special Investigations, Financial Intelligence Unit at American Express
persons.context: She is the recipient of the main email from the AUSA and is involved in the document production process related to a subpoena. She previously communicated about access issues with a subpoena link in June 2020.

persons.name: Alison
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: She is the sender of the main email on July 23, 2021, requesting a call to ask follow-up questions regarding an earlier document production related to Epstein.

persons.name: Robert T Curran
persons.context: He was a recipient/cc'd on the prior email chain from June 29, 2020, regarding the Epstein subpoena.

persons.name: Yui Cheung Chow
persons.context: She was cc'd on the prior email chain from June 29, 2020, regarding the Epstein subpoena.

connections.description: Prosecutor (Alison) is contacting a financial investigations manager (Hendrickson) to follow up on a document production related to the Epstein investigation.
Both were involved in the prior email communication regarding an Epstein-related subpoena in June 2020.
Both were cc'd on the prior email communication regarding an Epstein-related subpoena in June 2020.

events.title: Subpoena Access Issue Reported
events.description: Kristina Hendrickson emails to report that the link for a subpoena is not available when opened.

events.title: AUSA Follow-up Request
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Alison requests a call with Kristina Hendrickson to ask follow-up questions regarding an earlier document production related to Epstein.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Epstein-related matters as of July 2021, over a year after his death.
American Express's Financial Intelligence Unit was involved in responding to a subpoena related to the Epstein investigation.
The email chain shows ongoing legal and investigative coordination between federal prosecutors and financial institution investigators.
A prior subpoena was issued with a secure access link that had availability issues in June 2020.
